item.title: U.S. Signals Backing for Self-Driving Cars
item.description:
U.S. Signals Backing for Self-Driving Cars

Federal auto safety regulators on Monday made it official: They are betting the nation's highways will be safer with more cars driven by machines and not people. In long-awaited guidelines for the booming industry of automated vehicles, the Obama administration promised strong safety oversight, but sent a clear signal to automakers that the door was wide open for driverless cars.

item.title: Live asynchronously.
item.description:
Live asynchronously.

We'll start by talking about how interruptions - even scheduled ones - can destroy your productivity. But first, a web comic: Did you see what happened? The boss came by and totally wrecked the developer's train of thought. And for what? To notify him that the next time he checked his email, a message would be there for him?

item.title: 'Snow Crash' author Neal Stephenson is hoping for weird, indie VR
item.description:
'Snow Crash' author Neal Stephenson is hoping for weird, indie VR

Neal Stephenson, who inspired much of the current VR industry with his novel Snow Crash, explained why he's excited about virtual reality and augmented reality - and it's for less technical reasons than you might think.

item.title: I quit my job, bought an army truck, and spent 19 months circumnavigating Africa
item.description:
I quit my job, bought an army truck, and spent 19 months circumnavigating Africa

We decided to go with an ex-military 4x4 truck which we could convert into an off-road campervan.

item.title: Theoretical design, experimental humans and pragmatic robots.
item.description:
Theoretical design, experimental humans and pragmatic robots.

From 2013-2016 I have had somewhat of a unique opportunity as a designer. What evolved into a massive R&D project into design itself in order to help create a web builder that allows anyone to build and design a website in three minutes.

item.title: Elon Musk: How to Build the Future
item.description:
Elon Musk: How to Build the Future

This interview with Elon Musk is from Y Combinator's How to Build the Future series

item.title: AI-designed websites have arrived, so what now for WordPress?
item.description:
AI-designed websites have arrived, so what now for WordPress?

It still takes hours, days,and weeks to create a well-designed website – and even then, they require far more maintenance than one might expect. In the age of machine learning, space microphones that can hear gravity, and cars that can drive themselves, the process of building a website still seems so unnecessarily clunky, even some 27 years since their invention.

item.title: No title
item.description: SpaceX President Shotwell: We anticipate return to flight in November, meaning down for three months. Next flight from CCAFS, then to VAFB.

item.title: How Google And Others Are Plotting The Revenge Of The Web App
item.description:
How Google And Others Are Plotting The Revenge Of The Web App

For Alex Russell, a developer at Google, making web apps better isn't just a job: It's a personal belief. Since last year, Russell has been championing a new breed of web-based apps that could replace the ones you get from an app store.

item.title: Ants are destroying your plants by nurturing perfect aphid colonies
item.description:
Ants are destroying your plants by nurturing perfect aphid colonies

One of the worst effects of ant infestation doesn't happen inside your house or on your picnic blanket. It takes place in farms and gardens, where many species of ants tend to herds of aphids. These tiny insects are a bane to plants-aphids weaken plants by feeding on their sap, and they sometimes transmit deadly viruses while eating.
